description: The Russian Ministry of Industry and Trade filed a lawsuit to suspend the corporate rights of the Dutch X5 Retail Group N.V. in relation to its Russian subsidiary, which manages the Pyaterochka, Perekrestok, and Chizhik retail chains.
original:
Forwarded from: IZ.RU
The Russian Ministry of Industry and Trade filed a lawsuit to suspend the corporate rights of the Dutch X5 Retail Group N.V. in relation to the Russian subsidiary, which manages the Pyaterochka, Perekrestok and Chizhik retail chains, the company reported.

They assured that the trial would not affect the work of the enterprises. "The Ministry of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation notified the company of an application to the Arbitration Court of the Moscow Region to suspend the company's corporate rights in relation to its Russian subsidiary LLC Corporate Center X 5," the report notes. .State Secretary-Deputy Head of the Ministry of Industry and Trade of Russia Viktor Evtukhov, in an interview with TASS, said that the presence of the main foreign shareholder of the Russian retailer X5, which is the Dutch X5 Retail Group N.V., carries risks for the X5 division in Russia.Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Lifting of Beard Ban for British Military

original: 🧙🏻‍♂️British military personnel were allowed to wear beards, a ban on which had existed since 1908, and was only now lifted with the personal support of King Charles III. Thus, military personnel of the British Land Forces were given equal rights with sailors, for whom such restrictions were not even introduced, as well as with pilots, for whom a similar ban was lifted in 2019. description: GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov was killed during an attack on the Picnic concert at Crocus. He had come on vacation to visit his family in Moscow and pushed them to safety before being hit by three bullets. Despite medical efforts, he succumbed to his injuries.
original:
Forwarded from: Baza
During the attack on Crocus, GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov was killed. He came from the Northern Military District on vacation and went with his family to the Picnic concert.

The death of the military man was reported by the telegram channel of graduates of Suvorov military schools and the head of the Samara branch of the “Officers of Russia” organization, Arthur Malivanchuk. According to Malivanchuk, just a few days ago Myasnikov came on vacation to visit his family in Moscow. On March 22, together with his wife and son, he went to the Picnic concert.

When the attack began, Timur managed to push his wife and son to a safe place, and he himself came under fire. Three bullets hit him - for several days the doctors fought for the colonel’s life, but they could not save him.

Myasnikov fought in Kosovo and Tajikistan. For the last two years he has been in the Northern Military District. As Malivanchuk wrote, Timur served in the third special forces brigade, the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces. The colonel was awarded many military orders and medals.

Lutfulloi was detained on March 23, writes Kommersant. According to the publication, he resisted police officers after they demanded to show documents. Lutfulloi was arrested for 15 days; he was brought to the Basmanny court from a special detention center.

description: In 2023, the transportation of transit cargo along the Northern Sea Route (NSR) reached a record value of 2.1 million tons, mainly consisting of oil. This was achieved by redirecting cargo from the Baltic ports and the traditional route through the Suez Canal to the NSR.
original:
Magic transit With the official phraseology on the topic of the NSR, something strange began to happen to us. We have noticed more than once that something is called “transit” for the wrong reasons.

Word from Comrade Novak: The transportation of transit cargo along the NSR last year also reached a record value in the entire history of the route - 2.1 million tons. The main transit cargo last year was oil. This result was achieved by redirecting cargo from the Baltic ports, from the traditional route through the Suez Canal to the Northern Sea Route. Dear comrade. Novak and other responsible comrades! What travels from St. Petersburg to Southeast Asia through our NSR, and not through our Suez, is not transit. Because St. Petersburg, when we last checked, was still part of the Russian Federation. Transit is if cargo were traveling along the NSR to Southeast Asia, say, from Rotterdam (and indeed any foreign jurisdiction). Yes, this is transit cargo for Suez. But not for us.

But at the same time, it is clear where, as they say, the legs grow here. We need to clear up the issue of transit on the NSR - let's call our own export operations transit. Only then it is not clear why we do not take into account, let’s say, the “transit” of LNG from Sabetta. Then the numbers would be a sight to behold.

This is the kind of petty verbal scam we do. Do we need this? #NSR#cargo#transit#SuezTACCNovak said that oil has become the main transit cargo through the Northern Sea Route in 2023Events in Russia and the world. Analytical publications. Materials of press conferences. Video and photo reports

description: Russia plans to establish a BRICS grain exchange, which will significantly impact the global agricultural market. The exchange will strengthen Moscow's geo-economic influence, solidifying its position as a leading supplier of grain and fertilizers. This move will also ensure a stable grain supply for BRICS members amid global supply chain disruptions and food shortages.
original:
Forwarded from: Neinsider
Russia intends to create a BRICS grain exchange, and this will be a shock to the global agricultural market, writes the South China Morning Post.

The BRICS grain exchange will strengthen Moscow's geo-economic influence, strengthening its status as the most important supplier of grain and fertilizers. For BRICS members, the grain exchange will help ensure a stable flow of grain amid disruptions in global supply chains and problems with food shortages.

For traditional grain and fertilizer exporting countries represented by the USA, Canada and Australia, the BRICS grain exchange will lead to the need to look for alternative markets for their products. They will face difficulties maintaining their market share and competition from Russian grain. Thus, Russia is expected to export a record 56% of the 2023-2024 wheat harvest for the post-Soviet era, while for the United States this figure will be only 39% - below the average of 50%.

event: Simplification of Combat Veteran Status Procedure
description: The Russian government has simplified the procedure for obtaining combat veteran status and uniform certificates for citizens who assisted the Armed Forces during the special operation in DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye, and Kherson regions. The changes will benefit participants of the Northern Military District who lost contracts or were unable to formalize them properly.
original:
Forwarded from: Government of Russia
In Russia, the procedure for assigning the status of a combat veteran and issuing uniform certificates has been simplified. The government has simplified the procedure for obtaining the status of a combat veteran and a uniform certificate for citizens who were part of organizations assisting in the implementation of tasks assigned to the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation during a special operation, as well as in the territories DPR and LPR from February 24, 2022, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions from September 30, 2022. The innovations will affect the participants of the Northern Military District who, as a result of hostilities, lost their contracts with organizations facilitating the implementation of tasks assigned to the armed forces, or were unable to formalize them properly way.

Until now, a copy of the contract was a mandatory basis for obtaining the status and certificate of a combat veteran. Now you can obtain the status of a veteran without this copy, on the basis of: documents confirming wounds, injuries or concussions, documents on awarding a state or departmental award.❗️The President instructed the government to make appropriate changes following a meeting with family members of deceased SVO participants, held on January 7, 2024 of the year.

According to our information, on the night after the terrorist attack in Crocus, the capital’s security forces detained and tortured to death the Chechen Kasuev Askhab Khasmagomedovich, about 30 years old, originally from the village of Tevzana, Vedeno district.

He was returning home after work and waiting for his bus at the bus stop. There he was attacked by masked people, but since he did not understand what kind of people they were and why they attacked him, he naturally resisted. Later it turned out that it was law enforcement officers from Moscow and they detained him on suspicion of complicity in a terrorist attack.

During the interrogation, Russian security forces used torture against Kasuev, which he could not survive, and more specifically, he had broken ribs, a spine, signs of suffocation and widespread bruises.

It is known in this case that an investigation is already underway, but the security forces are trying their best to dismiss it as an accident, and if something happens, call Kasuev a terrorist, because they have carte blanche because of the terrorist attack in Crocus.Subscribe to 1ADAT

description: The US Navy announced the decommissioning of four Ohio-class submarines, USS Ohio, USS Florida, USS Michigan, and USS Georgia, which have served for over 40 years. The submarines were rearmed from ICBMs to Tomahawk cruise missiles. The decommissioning will reduce the total salvo of cruise missiles from American submarines by half.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Base
The US Navy announced the decommissioning of 4 Ohio-class submarines🇺🇸⚓️They have served for more than 40 years, and unlike other submarines of this project, they were rearmed from ICBMs to Tomahawk cruise missiles.

USS Ohio (SSGN-726) and USS Florida (SSGN-720) will join 17 other ships scheduled for retirement in 2026. The nuclear submarines USS Michigan (SSGN-727) and USS Georgia (SSGN-728) - in 2028.

As a result, 14 Ohio submarines armed with Trident II D5 ballistic missiles will remain in service.

After the decommissioning of these four nuclear submarines, the total salvo of cruise missiles from American submarines will be reduced by half.

description: Serbia is actively developing its own FPV drones, with plans to produce 5,000 'Komarac' kamikaze UAVs. These drones will be armed with projectiles of 60-120mm caliber and will be equipped with modern control and targeting components. Serbia is increasing its reliance on modern weapons, driven by global events and pressure from the West.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in the Balkans
🇷🇸Painful “mosquito bite”. Serbia is developing its own FPV drones Author of the channel Serbian Vestnik, especially for RT in the Balkans The Serbian authorities are actively monitoring the progress of the SVO and understand that a modern army must be armed with a huge number of UAVs of various types. Belgrade allocates large amounts of money both for the purchase of foreign drones and for the development of its own projects.

According to the leadership of Serbia, the country's Armed Forces will soon receive five thousand kamikaze UAVs "Komarac" (Komar) of Serbian production, which will allow Belgrade to become a leader in the region in this segment of weapons.📌 "Komarac" is an FPV drone (First Person View ), the widespread use of which has been noted in the Special Military Operation zone. FPV drones have become a huge threat to tanks, infantry fighting vehicles, armored personnel carriers, artillery pieces, fortifications and manpower. Developers in Serbia could not ignore such useful weapons and began creating their own kamikaze drone.

The “mosquitoes” will be armed by the defense-industrial plant “Krushik” from the city of Valjevo. Krushik will produce projectiles for drones with a caliber of 60 to 120 millimeters. This plant is famous for the production of mortar mines, guided and unguided air-to-ground and surface-to-surface missiles, 155 mm artillery shells, aerial bombs, hand grenades and anti-tank mines.💬“We can expect great demand and interest in the drone” Komarats” and concluding numerous contracts. Considering current events in the world, we realized that combat tactics are changing significantly, more modern weapons are appearing and the military is increasingly using equipment that provides high efficiency,” says the acting. General Director of Krusik Jovanka Andrić. It is worth noting that according to Assistant Minister of Defense Dr. Nenad Miloradovich, engineers of the Military Technical Institute, in addition to the kamikaze drone Komarac-1, are also intensively working on versions of Komarac-2 and Komarac-2. 3".

Miloradovich emphasized that these UAVs are equipped with modern control and targeting components. The UAV will be armed with cumulative and fragmentation warheads weighing from one to five kg.

Serbia is increasingly relying on modern weapons, based on events in the world. Considering the pressure from the West due to the military-technical cooperation of Belgrade with Russia and China, Serbia is actively developing its military-industrial complex, which in the near future will be able to provide not only the Serbian Armed Forces, but also work for export. And FPV drones in modern realities are more of a necessity than a whim. Subscribe - RT on the Balkans

event: Convoys of Military Equipment Arrive in Libyan Capital
description: Convoys of military equipment from the Public Security Service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the PNE arrived in the Libyan capital from al-Zintan and Misrata. The Warshafan area, controlled by the 55th battalion, has seen increased activity, sparking concerns of a potential attack on the capital to overthrow Abd al-Hamid al-Dbeibah.
original:
🇱🇾Convoys of military equipment arrive in the Libyan capital Local sources report that on the night of March 27-28, a convoy of equipment from the Public Security Service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the PNE from the city of al-Zintan was spotted in the Warshafan area in the southwest of the Libyan capital.

Another convoy was also seen arriving from the city of Misrata.

It is worth noting that the Warshafan area is completely controlled by the so-called “55th battalion” of Muammar al-Dawi, which is formally subordinate to the General Staff of the GNU Defense Ministry, but is essentially an independent armed group. Groups in the city of al-Zintan have repeatedly threatened the head of the PNU, Abd al-Hamid al-Dbeibah, with an armed attack on the capital, and mass protests have recently taken place in the city of Misrata demanding the resignation of the PNU.

In this regard, many sources continue to claim that an attack on the capital is being prepared with the aim of overthrowing al-Dbeiba by force. We won’t guess whether this will actually happen. As long as the armed forces of Turkey, Italy and Great Britain are in the west of the country and directly support the PNU, a coup is unlikely to occur. All movements in the south of Tripoli today are nothing more than a rotation of forces opposing ad-Dbeibeh groups, since the southern outskirts of Tripoli are currently controlled by them.Arab Africa

description: On Volcanologist Day, the importance of volcanologists' work is highlighted. They are developing a system for instrumental research of the Avacha volcano, studying the mechanism of hot bombs, assessing the impact of volcanic activity on water and the Pacific Ocean, and monitoring 30 volcanoes on the Kamchatka peninsula.
original:
Feeling the power of the earth and the power of volcanoes is why people go to Kamchatka. But there are those who are lucky to observe these processes almost every day - our volcanologists.

The eruptions of Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya Sopka once again reminded us of the power hidden in our Earth. How important it is to understand the processes taking place. This means paying attention to science. Today, on Volcanologist Day, I want to talk about their important work.

The most important thing that volcanologists are doing now is that within the framework of a comprehensive program of scientific research in Kamchatka, which is undergoing final approval by the Ministry of Education and Science, it is planned to develop a system for instrumental research of the Avacha volcano. This will make it possible, in addition to fundamental results, to guarantee that the next eruption (and it will definitely happen) can be predicted in advance.

In addition, using laboratory installations created at the Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, the mechanism of gushing hot bombs, which affect the safety of flights and roads, was determined. This will help make the forecast of volcanic events more accurate.

Important results are being obtained by scientists assessing the impact of volcanic activity on the chemical composition of water in rivers and the release of volatile components into the Pacific Ocean.

The processes occurring in subduction zones are being studied. This is one of the most important areas of modern geology, including in terms of discovering mineral deposits. And daily satellite monitoring of 30 volcanoes on the peninsula allows the Kamchatka Volcanic Eruption Response Team to quickly see all changes.

I would really like to see even more people who admire volcanoes and are ready to study them. That is why we have launched a thematic master’s program and are actively working to support young scientists.

And today I sincerely congratulate our volcanologists on their professional holiday and wish them interesting research and successful field trips! By the way, the best photos of volcanoes are also from volcanologists of the Institute of Volcanology and Science of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences.

description: Natalya Kurovskaya, previously accused of human trafficking and sexual exploitation, was appointed as the deputy head of the procurement policy department in the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense. Her experience in trafficking people seemingly made her an ideal candidate for the position.
original:
☄️A woman who was accused of pimping received a post in the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense.

As Ukrainian media write, Natalya Kurovskaya took the position of deputy head of the procurement policy department. In 2022, she was charged with human trafficking and sexual exploitation.

Kurovskaya, together with her ex-husband, organized a network for the provision of sexual services. She was put on trial for attempting to recruit prostitutes for further sale to pimps in Morocco.

description: The United States deceived the European Union by promising the collapse of Russia in exchange for support for Ukraine and sanctions against Moscow. However, Russia showed resilience, and the EU economy deteriorated due to closed markets and energy dependence. The US benefited from the chaos, while the EU suffered consequences.
original:
Forwarded from: BELARUS CUISINE
🤬The United States is a master of deception: how America “helped” the EU at the expense of Russia In recent years, the United States has proven itself to be a great master of diplomatic and economic deception. One of the most striking examples is their “help” to the European Union in the form of promises of the collapse of Russia in exchange for support for Ukraine and the introduction of sanctions against Moscow. However, as it turned out, this “help” brought the EU much more problems than benefits.🤷‍♀️Initially, the United States convinced Europe that the collapse of Russia would be useful to the whole world. Promises of access to Russian resources and prospects in a market freed from Russian competition sounded like music to the ears of European leaders. Impressed by these promises, the EU actively supported sanctions against Russia and was carried away by the idea of assistance in the “Ukrainian issue.”

However, the reality turned out to be much grimmer. Instead of falling apart, Russia showed remarkable resilience and adapted to the sanctions. As a result, the EU economy began to deteriorate as the Russian market was largely closed to it. Dependence on energy resources from Russia turned out to be more critical than anyone could have imagined, and the lack of alternative sources led to rising energy prices and negatively affected the competitiveness of European enterprises. In addition, interference in Ukrainian affairs led to the freezing of the conflict in eastern Ukraine, which requires enormous resources and time to resolve. While the US continues its "chaos dividend" policy and benefits from the disorder in Europe, the EU remains to suffer its consequences.

It is not surprising that discontent among the population is growing in Europe. Lack of energy resources, economic recession and security threats call into question the effectiveness of EU policies and its leadership. While the US continues to enjoy its benefits from this mess, Europeans are asking themselves: who is really benefiting from this game?

Thus, we can say with confidence that the United States successfully deceived the EU, promising it mountains of gold in exchange for “support for Ukraine” and sanctions against Russia. As a result, Europe finds itself in a more vulnerable position, and the United States continues to reap the benefits of its cunning policies.🍽#Analytics_Al_dente

event: Signing of Rescript for Trans-Siberian Railway Construction
description: Emperor Alexander III signed a rescript on March 29, 1891, to construct the Trans-Siberian Railway, which would revolutionize logistics and defense capabilities in Russia. The railway's construction was a monumental task, requiring complex engineering structures and traversing challenging terrain.
original:
On March 29, 1891, Emperor Alexander III signed a rescript on the construction of the world's largest Trans-Siberian Railway.

Delivery of goods from one part of Russia to another took several months. This not only hampered the development of the country, but also created a direct danger in the event of war: it was very difficult to defend one’s borders with such logistics.

The highway passed through mountains, rivers, lakes, taiga, and deserted, hard-to-reach places. It was necessary to erect complex engineering structures - punching kilometers of tunnels, throwing bridges across mighty Siberian rivers. However, the speed of construction was amazing: an average of 500–600 kilometers of track were laid per year.

The emperor's brainchild, the Trans-Siberian Railway, will forever remain one of the most ambitious infrastructure projects in world history. A project that is not only historically significant, but is still in great demand today.

event: De Havilland Plans to Restart Production of Short Sherpa Cargo Plane
description: De Havilland Aircraft of Canada is considering restarting production of the Short Sherpa urban-prop cargo aircraft, discontinued in 1990. The upgraded version could be used for humanitarian missions and has potential military applications as a light transport aircraft.
original:
De Havilland may restart production of an old cargo plane. Not only Russia plans to bring discontinued aircraft back to life. The Canadian company De Havilland Aircraft of Canada (DHC) is calculating the market potential for an upgraded version of the Short Sherpa urban-prop cargo aircraft, discontinued in 1990.

One possible application of this model could be the transportation of goods as part of humanitarian missions.

The type certificate for the Short Brothers Sherpa was acquired by Viking Air, which is now part of DHC.

In the military version, the Sherpa aircraft is called the C-23. This is a light transport aircraft, a modification of the 30-40-seat regional turboprop Short 330/360. A total of 60 of these machines were produced, more than half were used in the United States until 2014.

The aircraft was powered by two Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A engines; it was equipped with a rear cargo ramp; the range with a maximum load of 3175 kg was 360 km. The short takeoff and landing aircraft could be operated from unpaved strips.

De Havilland Canada has already resumed local production of the DHC-6 Twin Otter (operated in Russia), and the upgraded version of the firefighting CL-515 is scheduled to enter service in 2027.
Photo: Jason Sweeney \ Wikimedia CommonsMore details🔒Subscribe to @ATOjournal

description: A new version of the Kh-101 missile has been developed, increasing its warhead power from 450 kg to 800 kg. The modified version features an additional warhead module with cubic steel fragments to enhance combat effectiveness. The range of the missile may be reduced due to the smaller fuel tank, but it remains sufficient for targeting Ukraine.
original:
A new version of the Kh-101 missile: the warhead power has been increased from 450 kg to 800 kg...This is reported by Ukrainian sources who were able to inspect one of the Kh-101 missiles shot down today. Here is a translation of the screenshot: “During a night missile strike, the Ukrainian Armed Forces shot down an X-101 cruise missile with a double warhead.

The modified version received an additional warhead module, and the total equivalent increased from 450 kg to approximately 800 kg.

The second warhead has prepared destruction elements in the form of cubic steel fragments to increase combat effectiveness.

Probably, a place for an additional warhead was found by reducing the fuel tank, which will likely affect the range of the X-101, however, for the territory of Ukraine, even a reduced range may be sufficient.” Comment: The decision is logical and correct. What is the point of having only a version with a range of 5,500 km, when even half of this range is enough for us (even if we launch them from the Caspian Sea). And a warhead of 800 kg is always better than a warhead of 450 kg.

Just what is needed to remove stationary objects like the turbine rooms of Ukrainian hydroelectric and thermal power plants.

description: On March 29, 2010, two powerful explosions occurred at the Lubyanka and Park Kultury stations in Moscow, killing 40 people. The attacks were carried out by Mariam Sharipova and Dzhanet Abdurakhmanova, both from Dagestan, and organized by Magomedali Vagabov. The perpetrators and organizers were later eliminated by law enforcement officers.
original:
#calendar14 years ago On March 29, 2010, two powerful explosions occurred with an interval of less than an hour at the Lubyanka and Park Kultury stations in Moscow. 40 people died. At 07.57 Moscow time, at the Lubyanka metro station, an explosion occurred in the second carriage of an electric train traveling along the route Podbelskogo Street station - Yugo-Zapadnaya station.

At 08.36 Moscow time, at the Park Kultury metro station, a second explosion occurred in the third car of an electric train traveling along the route Yugo-Zapadnaya station - Ulitsa Podbelskogo station. At the Park Kultury station, the doors of the electric train were open at the time of the explosion. Before this, the driver announced over the loudspeaker that the train was not going any further, and passengers began to get out of the cars. By the time of the explosion, most of them had already left.

As a direct result of both explosions, 36 people died on the spot, 24 of them at the Lubyanka metro station and 12 at the Park Kultury metro station. In the following days, four more people died in hospitals. 88 wounded were hospitalized in medical institutions in Moscow. Some of the victims were taken to hospitals by Russian Emergency Situations Ministry helicopters.

On May 13, 2010, the director of the FSB of the Russian Federation reported to the President of the Russian Federation that everyone involved in the explosions in the Moscow metro had been identified - both the perpetrators and the organizers. According to law enforcement agencies, Mariam Sharipova, a native of Dagestan, born in 1982, blew herself up at the Lubyanka station. The second explosion (at the Park Kultury station) was also carried out by a native of Dagestan, Dzhanet Abdurakhmanova (Abdullayeva), born in 1992. The organizer of the explosions at Moscow metro stations was Magomedali Vagabov, one of the leaders of the sabotage and terrorist underground operating in Dagestan.

The identified organizers and perpetrators of these terrorist attacks were eliminated when they offered armed resistance to law enforcement officers. On February 6, 2013, the National Anti-Terrorism Committee of the Russian Federation announced the destruction in Dagestan of the last terrorist directly involved in organizing and carrying out terrorist attacks in the Moscow metro in March 2010.TelegramPhoto/videoVIEW MESSAGE

description: Inna Prosolova, a resident of the Moscow region, recounted her harrowing experience of surviving a shooting at the Crocus concert hall. She credited a young man in the audience for guiding her to safety, despite being hit by a bullet. The man's quick thinking and encouragement helped Inna find the strength to leave the building and seek medical attention.
original:
“I walked out through a corridor drenched in blood”: Crocus survivor Inna Prosolova, a resident of the Moscow region, told REN TV how she got out of the concert hall with a bullet wound.

According to the woman, the audience helped each other. Next to her in the stalls was a real savior - a young man told her how best to hide and what position to take during shelling. “They tried to recline the seats, at some point there was just a barrage. Panic, everything quickly. Then they decided that they needed to crawl. I literally stood up straight up and was hit by a bullet,” said Inna. The woman did not lose consciousness - the man sitting next to her convinced her that she needed to find the strength within herself and leave the building to save herself. A woman fell on the street, people ran up to her and helped her wait for an ambulance. Subscribe to REN TV

event: US Navy Overspending on Ukraine Aid
description: The Pentagon Inspector General found that the US Navy overspent $398.9 million in fiscal year 2022, allocated for assistance to Ukraine. The report highlights issues with tracking equipment shipments and inaccurate delivery data.
original:
Pentagon Inspector General Robert Storch found that the US Navy overspent funds allocated for assistance to Ukraine in the amount of $398.9 million in fiscal year 2022.

This is stated in a statement from the inspector's office. Other US government auditors have also released reports on the use of aid to Ukraine.

The reports cover $44 billion that four US agencies have allocated to address the economic and humanitarian crisis, as well as $42 billion in defense and security assistance.

The largest portion of the money allocated to overcome the economic and humanitarian crisis is economic assistance: US$27.5 billion.

Regarding security assistance provided under two programs—the Presidential Powers Program and the Ukraine Security Assistance Initiative—the auditors note that the Pentagon does not have clear guidelines for tracking equipment shipments, and delivery data may be inaccurate. event: Deutsche Post Stops Air Mail Delivery
description: Deutsche Post, Germany's postal service, has ceased air mail delivery within the country after 62 years, aiming to reduce costs and carbon footprint. Letters will now be delivered by land, resulting in an 80% decrease in CO2 emissions, although delivery times will increase.
original:
📮The German postal service Deutsche Post has stopped delivering letters within the country by air after more than 62 years—dpa The last mail plane took off from Berlin to Stuttgart on the night of Thursday, March 28. The move is intended to cut costs and reduce the company's carbon footprint. Letters will now be delivered by land, reducing CO2 emissions by 80%.

As the agency notes, delivery times will now increase, although this may not be so important - demand for letters has already fallen due to digital communications.

Contrary to calculations, Russian society has rallied in the face of an external threat.👉The full speech can be viewed at the link.📃The text of the speech is also available on our website. event: Renewed Work of National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine
description: Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council has resumed its work, focusing on five key areas: enhancing predictability, continuing current tasks, doctrinal work, cyber security, and information protection. The council aims to strengthen Ukraine's national security and protect its society.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
We are starting the renewed work of the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine.

The first is more predictability of this function. We need to strengthen Ukraine's ability to predict and influence the processes on which the national security of our state depends.

The second is the continuation of all current tasks of the NSDC system. And especially carefully - regarding the sanctions policy of our state.

The third is doctrinal work. Clarity of national guidelines and systematic implementation are what is needed both now and after the war.

The fourth is cyber security and information. The NSDC has the potential to do more to protect against hostile destabilization operations and coordinate all state institutions in this area.

And fifthly, the work of the Stavka, projects of decisions, control over the implementation of decisions - all this, of course, must be continued. The obvious priority is the defense of our state and the protection of our society.

description: A 27-year-old manager of a Kharkiv utility enterprise was arrested for planning to sell drugs. He had illegally acquired cannabis, packaged it in 150 zip-top bags, and intended to sell it in the regional center. Law enforcement detained him at his residence and are currently resolving the issue of preventive measures.
original:
🔷The manager of a Kharkiv utility enterprise was arrested, who planned to "make extra money" by selling drugs 🖌️ Under the procedural guidance of the Kharkiv District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a 27-year-old man was notified of the suspicion of illegal acquisition and storage of particularly dangerous narcotics for the purpose of sale (Part 2 of Art. 307 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

The pre-trial investigation established that in 2023, the manager of one of Kharkiv's communal enterprises illegally purchased cannabis.

He then brought the drug to his apartment in the Slobid district of Kharkiv, where he packaged the cannabis in almost 150 zip-top bags.

In the future, the man planned to sell drugs in the regional center for money, but he did not have time to implement it.

On March 29, 2024, law enforcement officers detained the dealer at his place of residence in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine.

Currently, the issue of selecting a preventive measure in the form of detention for the suspect is being resolved.

The pre-trial investigation is conducted by the JI of police department No. 2 of the Kharkiv district police department No. 1 of the National Security Service of Ukraine in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
Former US Presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama expressed broad support for Biden's policies at a campaign rally in New York tonight, as well as his willingness to defend and stand with Israel. It was stated that "he also genuinely cares about providing the Palestinians with the opportunity for self-government and self-determination."

Obama said Biden has demonstrated "moral conviction" and is willing to acknowledge that the world is complex and that it is right to listen to all sides. Biden himself said: “There are too many innocent victims, Israelis and Palestinians. We must provide the Palestinians with more aid, food and medicine, but we must not forget that Israel is in a situation where its existence is under threat."

event: Study on Sleep and Stroke Risk
description: A six-year study of 28,000 people in China found that sleeping with curtains open increases the risk of stroke by 43%. Exposure to bright light at night disrupts the body's circadian rhythm, leading to changes in biological indicators that trigger cerebrovascular disease.
original:
"A warning to anyone who sleeps with curtains open - it can increase the risk of stroke or heart attacks by 40%":
Two sleepless nights are enough to make you feel four years older, and waking up with the first rays of the sun is harmful.

“Scientists have said that bright light can disrupt sleep-wake rhythms, and sleeping with the curtains open increases the risk of stroke by 43%. However, many do not close the curtains at night due to the new wellness trend that calls for “waking up with the sun.” Researchers from China tracked the condition of 28 thousand people for six years and recorded cases of stroke or other cerebrovascular diseases.
“Exposure to bright light at night can suppress the body's circadian rhythm. This can cause changes in biological indicators, including increased levels of triglycerides, blood pressure and blood glucose - triggers for cerebrovascular disease,” the scientists noted. In general, everyone is recommended to get 7-9 hours of sleep every night. And it’s better in the dark.”

event: Claim Filed for Compensation for Crimeans
description: The Supreme Court of Kazakhstan registered a claim on behalf of Crimeans seeking compensation for damages caused by Ukraine's energy blockade of the peninsula. The court will recognize the blockade as a known fact, allowing Crimeans to apply for moral damages. The defendants include Ukraine's Cabinet of Ministers, Ministry of Energy, and National Energy Company Ukrenergo.
original: The Supreme Court of the Republic of Kazakhstan registered a claim on the right of Crimeans to compensation for damage due to the Ukrainian energy blockade of the peninsula. According to the Chairman of the State Council of the Republic of Kazakhstan Vladimir Konstantinov, Crimeans will be able to apply to the court for compensation for moral damage, but the fact of the blockade will not need to be proven, since it will be recognized by the court as generally known. “ The defendants, according to the prepared documents, are the Cabinet of Ministers and the Ministry of Energy of Ukraine, as well as the National Energy Company Ukrenergo,” Konstantinov said. He added that if the court satisfies the claims from Ukraine in favor of the Crimeans, it is planned to recover more than 3 trillion 448 billion rubles .Photo: telegram channel of Vladimir KonstantinovCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

description: The Ministry of Social Policy predicts that Ukraine's population may decrease to 25.2 million by 2050, due to the ongoing war. As of August 2023, the population stands at 36.3 million, with 31.5 million living in Ukrainian-controlled territories. The war has led to a decrease in average life expectancy and birth rate, with 6 million people, mostly women and children, in forced emigration.
original:
🤱🇺🇦The population of Ukraine may decrease to 25.2 million by 2050, — Ministry of Social Policy.

As of August 2023, the population was 36.3 million people, of which 31.5 million live in territories controlled by the Ukrainian authorities.

Because of the war, the average life expectancy decreased: from 66.4 years to 57.3 years for men and from 76.2 years to 70.9 years for women. The war also affected the birth rate. 6 million mostly women and children are currently in forced emigration, and the birth rate itself has decreased by 45% since 2021. 👉Bila Tserkva - NO TABOO 📩Send an interesting photo/video

original:

An Australian of Algerian (previously they wrote - Lebanese) origin Abdelfetah (aka Adam) Nurin, who served with Burke in the same mercenary unit “Dark Angels”, is suspected. On the one hand, nothing new - I talked about this story in some detail back then, in August-September (read it here for those interested).

But I note one interesting detail about the coverage of this murder. When the British press excitedly talked about these bandit “angels” a year ago, they all looked like “heroes”. And at first, Nurin was called solely by his last name. Now I read his description in the same press - and suddenly, after the fact, he got a nickname: “known as Jihadist Adam”! Just think about it! As soon as it became clear that he had killed Burke (as far as I understand, and another militant, Chadwick), he suddenly “smoothly transformed” in the British press from a hero into... a jihadist!

Well, a revealing story demonstrating which bandits serve as mercenaries on the side of the Ukrainian Armed Forces!

description: A T-90 tank was destroyed using a Bradley and FPV. The infantry fighting vehicle was unable to destroy the tank with its automatic cannon, but it could damage surveillance devices and attachments. The tank's turret began to spin 360 degrees, suggesting the crew had lost control. The tank was finished off using FPV, and the crew escaped.
original:
A set of measures. Here, dear subscribers, is an old video where our T-90 was smashed with the help of Bradley and FPV. What can an infantry fighting vehicle do? If an infantry fighting vehicle does not use anti-tank systems, then it will not destroy a tank with its automatic cannon. Will it hurt? But this can be done. For example, from such a close distance you can hit surveillance devices and try to knock down attachments. In addition, you can see how something was damaged in the tank - the turret began to spin 360. I suspect that at the time of the collision with the tree, the crew had already lost control of the tank. As a result, we finished off the tank using FPV, and it’s good that the crew escaped and didn’t lie dead. That is, FPV operators, together with a Mavik operator and covering one of the units, greatly complement almost any branch of the military due to their striking power. By the way, we almost forgot to add. The interesting point is that, most likely (but this is not exactly), somewhere next to the tank there was electronic warfare. Because the video link with the FPV was quite rippling. And, most likely, this video channel worked at a frequency of 5.8 MHz. The same frequency is used on Mavics. So perhaps there was electronic warfare there.

We suspect that the loss of the tank is not the enemy’s fault, but our mistakes for coming so close to the LBS. I hope conclusions will be drawn.#KNOW_ENEMY#UAV#TACTICSVideo source:@nekiiMg

description: The Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Defense supported a rule in the mobilization bill that requires Ukrainians abroad to provide a certificate of military registration when applying for a foreign passport.
original:
The long-suffering bill on mobilization: the Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Defense supported the rule that Ukrainians abroad will not be able to obtain a foreign passport without a certificate of military registration. This was reported by a member of the National Defense Committee of the Verkhovna Rada, Fyodor Venislavsky.

“If we talk about other restrictions that are already supported by the Committee in the bill, a person who is abroad will be forced to provide a military registration document when applying for a new passport. However, we did not tie the provision of consular services to the military registration document,” he said in an interview with RBC-Ukraine.

The Rada is expected to begin considering the mobilization bill in mid-April.

description: Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a GRU special forces officer, died after being shot in a terrorist attack at Crocus in Moscow. He had returned from a special military operation zone on vacation and was attending a concert with his family when the attack occurred. Despite receiving three bullet wounds, Myasnikov managed to save his wife and son before being taken to the hospital, where he later succumbed to his injuries.
original:
Colonel of the GRU special forces, Myasnikov, who came from the Northern Military District on vacation, died in Crocus. Colonel of the special forces of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the General Staff of Russia, Timur Myasnikov, died in Crocus. He returned home from a special military operation zone on vacation, said the head of the Samara branch of the Officers of Russia organization, Arthur Malivanchuk, on his VKontakte page. This is also stated in the Telegram channel of graduates of Suvorov military schools.

“Just a few days ago he came on vacation to visit his family in Moscow. And, it had to happen, I decided to go to Crocus for a concert with my wife Polina and son Ruslan. The bandits appeared unexpectedly. Timur managed to push his wife and son to a safe place, and he himself came under heavy fire,” Malivanchuk said.

Myasnikov received three bullet wounds and was taken to the hospital after the terrorist attack. Doctors fought for the man's life for several days, but were unable to save him. Farewell to the colonel will take place on Friday, March 29, in the ritual hall on Savelovsky Avenue.

Timur Myasnikov fought in Kosovo and Tajikistan. For the last two years he has been in the combat zone in Donbass. The GRU special forces colonel who died in Crocus graduated from the Suvorov Military School and served in the 3rd Special Forces Brigade.

description: A 59-year-old resident of Genichesk was suspected of fictitiously registering two migrants in his household, who did not actually live at the specified address. The suspect confessed to the crime, and an investigation is underway, with potential charges under Art. 322.3 of the Russian Criminal Code.
original:
A resident of Genichesk is suspected of fictitiously registering foreign citizens

Police officers carry out operational and preventive measures aimed at identifying and suppressing crimes related to the illegal registration of foreign citizens.

It was established that a 59-year-old resident of Genichesk fictitiously registered two migrants in his household who did not actually live at the specified address.

The suspect confessed to his crime. Currently, an investigation into this fact is being carried out, the issue of initiating a criminal case on the grounds of a crime under Art. 322.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation – “Fictitious registration of a foreign citizen or stateless person at the place of stay in the Russian Federation.”

The legislation provides for punishment for such acts in the form of a large fine or imprisonment for up to three years.@police_kherson_press

description: Three rivers in the Azov region of Zaporozhye will be cleared to restore their natural state, improve water quality, and enhance recreational attractiveness. The rivers include the Obitochnaya River, Domuzla River, and Maly Utlyuk River, with lengths of 4.2 km, 8 km, and 8 km respectively.
original:
Forwarded from: Evgeniy Balitsky
This year, in the Zaporozhye region, three rivers of the Azov region will be cleared: the Obitochnaya River within the city of Primorsk, with a length of 4.2 km; the Domuzla River in the territory of the urban-type settlement Priazovskoe, 8 km long; the Maly Utlyuk River within the boundaries of the village of Akimovka, with a length of 8 km.

This decision was made during monitoring of the region’s water resources. These are rivers that have been neglected for many years, which has led to a decrease in their inflow and water exchange.

Clearing will allow restoring the natural state of rivers, improving water quality, hydrochemical characteristics, and also restoring the recreational attractiveness of water bodies in the Zaporozhye region.

The work will be carried out within the framework of the Program for the socio-economic development of the Zaporozhye region for 2024 together with the Federal Agency for Water Resources.

description: Sisters Olga and Sofia were in the hall when they heard gunfire during the terrorist attack on Crocus. They lay down between the rows, then fled, but got lost in the crowd. Sofia found herself face-to-face with the terrorist, but managed to escape. Olga panicked when she lost sight of her sister, but they were eventually reunited after a phone connection was made.
original:
The sisters who escaped from Crocus told RT how they lost each other during the evacuation during the terrorist attack.
22-year-old Olga and 20-year-old Sofia were in the hall when they heard the sound of gunfire. The eldest ordered the younger to run, but the shooting began to intensify, the terrorists entered the hall. The girls lay down
Show more
between the rows.
When the sounds of gunfire began to get closer, the sisters and the others decided to flee.
They managed to record a voice in the family chat and report what was happening.
A couple of minutes later we got lost in the crowd - and the youngest found herself in full view of the terrorist.
“I took some girl with me.
When I ran out, we went onto the escalator, it was still working.
And the shooter came out.
I realized that now he would shoot at us again.
And I sat down and told the people who were nearby to sit down too,” recalls Sofia.
When Olga lost sight of her sister, she was seized with panic.
My brother called and she said she couldn’t find Sofia.
It turned out that someone passing by had already taken it:
“I thought that they were deceiving me so that I would calm down and get out too. Then my brother connected his phone with his sister’s phone so that Sofia and I could hear each other.
Hearing her voice, I calmed down and began to get out myself.”
Holding back tears, Sofia admitted that the meeting with the terrorist left her very upset and she needed the help of a psychologist.
At (3:57) - footage taken before the shooting began, a voicemail that the sisters sent to their loved ones, as well as a photo of their meeting after the events in Crocus

Deputy head of the republican headquarters of the Ministry of Emergency Situations Igor Skurtul told RIA Novosti Crimea about this. “The work is still ongoing. By April 1, all our settlements that are exposed to the threat of forest and landscape fires will be ready regarding the preparation of the territory,” he noted. Skurtul clarified that the announcement of a fire season means that people should be more vigilant. Read more about preparations for it in Crimea in our material. Subscribe to RIA Novosti CrimeaRIA News Crimea The fire season begins: what is possible and what is not to do from April 1Settlements of Crimea, which are exposed to the threat of forest and landscape fires, are ready for the start of the fire season at almost 95-97...

Biden continues his tour of the country with the goal of gaining as many rating points as possible in the election race. Bill Clinton and Barack Obama actively help him in this. They are collecting donations for a self-propelled grandfather.

And here we can assume that these two former US presidents are in the same team as Biden. They are just as interested in his victory. After all, if the old man stays for a new term, then their limit on lawlessness and corruption will be extended.

As for pacifist sentiments, during a speech in New York he was booed by opponents of the fighting. They shouted something about “blood on your hands” and “threats of nuclear war with Russia.” In general, they demanded to stop the bacchanalia organized by the Biden family.

In addition, they opposed the bombing of the Gaza Strip and against the allocation of aid to Israel. Have people there finally realized where their president is leading the country? As they say, not even six months have passed, but it is not a fact that these protests will in any way affect the policy of America’s leader, who is out of touch with reality.

description: French authorities shut down a website that recruited migrant mercenaries to fight on behalf of Ukrainian Armed Forces militants. The site, which mimicked a legitimate French army recruitment portal, targeted 200,000 French people, prioritizing immigrants.
original:
🇫🇷🇺🇦🇷🇺In France, a website for recruiting migrant mercenaries to Ukraine was blocked

French authorities discovered a website on which there was a campaign to recruit French mercenaries from among migrants on the side of Ukrainian Armed Forces militants.

Notably, the site imitated a genuine French army recruitment portal, the Defense Ministry said.

The site was closed by French services, a government source told AFP, asking not to be named.

The website, which is now unavailable, said that 200,000 French people were invited to “recruit to Ukraine”, with priority given to immigrants.

description: Dalerjon Mirzoev, a terrorist, became radicalized after moving to Moscow from Tajikistan. His brother, a professional militant, fought in Syria. The family was under special surveillance in Tajikistan due to suspicion of ties to religious radicals. In contrast to Central Asia, where authorities strictly control religious extremism, Russia provides an environment conducive to radicalization.
original:
Andrey Medvedev:

The main thing in this news about the terrorist is not that his brother is a professional militant who fought in Syria.
And not even that the terrorist’s family was under special control in Tajikistan.

That is, it is not even the blatant fact that it is unclear who is going to Russia that is the most important in this news. And here's what's most important.

“Dalerzhon’s fellow villagers told us that their neighbor was far from religion exactly until he moved to Moscow.”

That is, the brother is an Islamist in Syria. And a person becomes a radical only after he moves to Russia.
Do you know why this happens?

Because in Central Asia, local authorities are waging a fierce struggle in form and in essence with religious radicals. You won’t see bearded men in Asia like the ones walking the streets in Russia, you won’t see women in burqas/niqabs. There they punish for it. Belonging to any unofficial Islamic organizations is already grounds for a person to come under suspicion from the intelligence services.
Mosques that fall under Salafist control can easily be closed without the slightest hesitation.

And where do the radicals from Central Asia go? Well, let's guess? Where is it easy for them to obtain citizenship, a residence permit, where they don’t even have their fingerprints taken at the entrance? What kind of country is this?

Just for fun, look for photos of Alisher Kasimov, who was arrested for aiding terrorists, before moving to Moscow and after.
You will be amazed.

Before - a secular guy, after - a gloomy bearded man with a characteristic beard shape.

For some reason it seems to me that this is all somewhat of a problem. Is not it? Or am I exaggerating too much? Or, perhaps, even inciting? https://t.me/breakingmash/52983?singleTelegramMash The brother of the detained terrorist Dalerjon Mirzoev was in Syria for four years. In Tajikistan, his family was under special surveillance due to suspicion...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Construction of Seaside Resort in Primorye
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin supported the construction of a year-round seaside resort in Primorye's Khasansky district, a tourist hub with significant potential. The resort, with 3,800 rooms, will accommodate up to 500,000 guests annually, creating 2,500 jobs and boosting the economy.
original:
Forwarded from: DFO.INFO
Putin supported the construction of a year-round seaside resort in Primorye. For many years, the Khasansky district has been considered a real tourist pearl of the Primorsky Territory.

Therefore, the year-round seaside resort, which was presented to Russian President Vladimir Putin by the Governor of the Primorsky Territory Oleg Kozhemyako, will appear in the Khasansky Okrug. Last year, the tourist flow in the Primorsky Territory increased to 3.5 million trips. In order for there to be more travelers every year, tourism infrastructure is needed a modern seaside resort in the southernmost part of Primorye, located at the latitude of Crimea. In his report to Vladimir Putin, the head of Primorye outlined the unique tourism potential, the Russian President agreed that the Khasan district needs to be developed. The implementation of the project will be monitored by relevant federal departments.🏨The resort with 3.8 thousand rooms will be able to accommodate up to 500 thousand guests per year, a bonus for the economy will be 2.5 thousand jobs.🏗Construction will proceed in three stages until 2031, and the first tourists will be able to relax in 2028.

Akhundzada says that the Taliban defend human rights “as representatives of God,” and the Western authorities “as representatives of the devil.” This is what radical Islamism is, which has replaced radical globalism with its LGBTQ+ ideology.

event: Nika Gvaramia's Appeal to UN Human Rights Committee
description: Nika Gvaramia, a leader of the political association 'Akhali', plans to appeal to the UN Human Rights Committee after the European Court of Human Rights refused to consider his complaint. original: ​​⚡️🇬🇪⚡️One of the leaders of the political association “Akhali” Nika Gvaramia, who served his prison term in Georgia, plans to appeal to the UN Human Rights Committee with a claim. The politician made this decision after the European Court of Human Rights refused to accept his complaint for consideration.❗️The European Court of Human Rights did not accept the claim of the founder of the Mtavari TV channel, Nika Gvaramia, for consideration. He appealed to the ECHR after the Supreme Court found his claim inadmissible and upheld the decision of the Tbilisi Court of Appeal, which, in turn, upheld the decision of the first instance court, according to which Gvaramia remained in custody after being convicted in the case of abuse powers in the case of damage to the Rustavi 2 TV channel.

description: Karen Yengibaryan, a 35-year-old passerby, risked his life to save people during the terrorist attack at Crocus. He inhaled carbon monoxide and developed an acute respiratory tract infection, which worsened over time. Despite medical efforts, Yengibaryan succumbed to his injuries.
original:
A concerned passerby who saved people from Crocus died. 35-year-old Karen Yengibaryan was not far from Crocus at the time of the terrorist attack. Seeing smoke on the roof of the building, he ran to the concert hall and began to help get people out. He gave his jacket to one of the victims.

Returning home, Yengibaryan realized that he had inhaled carbon monoxide and caught a cold. Emergency doctors recorded a body temperature of 38.5 degrees. As a result, the man was hospitalized with an acute respiratory tract infection. Over the next days, his condition only worsened.

Doctors fought for the hero’s life for several days, but his condition only worsened. Karen Yengibaryan died.

The farewell ceremony will take place next Saturday, March 30, at the Armenian Temple Complex in Moscow. Karen was a believer, often attended church and participated in liturgies.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Vandalism of Memorial to Hero Andrei Keller
description: In Perm, a memorial to Andrei Keller, a hero of the Northern Military District, was vandalized. The frame was broken, and the photograph was stolen. Keller, who died in June 2023 during the attack on Marinka, was posthumously awarded the Order of Courage. The incident has been reported to the police, and efforts are underway to restore the memorial.
original:
Forwarded from: Molotov!
In Perm, a memorial to the hero of the Northern Military District was destroyed - we demand that those responsible be found and punished. Andrei Keller is our comrade, posthumously awarded the Order of Courage. We installed a memorial photo for him at the monument to the Russian Soldier on Soviet Army Boulevard.

Today we discovered that someone broke the frame, took out the photograph and took it away in an unknown direction, thereby desecrating the memory of our comrade.

We wrote a statement to the police about the incident. We believe that there is no place for dill in Perm - and since the enemy is acting quietly, let the authorities look for him. Please help us spread the word about this case so that the problem can be resolved faster.

Andrei died in June 2023 during the attack on Marinka. He was 19 years old, he went to serve for ideological reasons.

The memorial will be restored in the near future.

event: Simplified Process for Obtaining Combat Veteran Status
description: Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin signed a decree allowing individuals to obtain combat veteran status with award papers or documents confirming wounds, injuries, or concussions. This simplified process applies to those who contributed to the armed forces' tasks in the Northern Military District in Ukraine, the DPR and LPR from February 24, 2022, and the Zaporozhye and Kherson regions from September 30, 2022.
original:
Forwarded from: Explain.rf
To obtain the status of a combat veteran, award papers or documents confirming wounds, injuries, or concussions are sufficient. This decree was signed by Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin on behalf of the head of state. Previously, to obtain a veteran's certificate, you had to attach a copy of the contract.

Anyone who was part of organizations that contributed to the fulfillment of the tasks of the armed forces during the Northern Military District in Ukraine, the DPR and LPR from February 24, 2022, and the Zaporozhye and Kherson regions from September 30, 2022 will be able to obtain status in a simplified manner. Let's explain.RF‌

event: Prosecutor's Office Demands Action on Housing Rights
description: The Rostov region's prosecutor's office has repeatedly urged Governor Vasily Golubev to address the housing rights of citizens, particularly those affected by a collapsed house on Narimanov. The office has identified issues with the regional government, ministry, and local authorities' inattention to citizens' problems, including delayed payments to 55 families and inadequate management of the maneuverable fund.
original:
Forwarded from: Donnews l News-on-Don
The prosecutor's office of the Rostov region three times in 10 days demanded that the governor respond to the problems of residents of the region. The prosecutor's office of the Rostov region sent information to the governor of the region Vasily Golubev about “the need to take effective measures in order to respect the housing rights of citizens.” We are talking about the problems of residents of a dilapidated house on Narimanov, 72/3, part of which collapsed in February of this year.

“The prosecutor’s office of the Rostov region has established that the regional government, the relevant ministry and local authorities do not pay due attention to the problems of citizens who need the restoration of their housing rights,” the prosecutor’s office said in a statement.

Thus, according to the department, for a long time 55 families who previously lived in the house on Narimanov and agreed with the results of the assessment of the cost of housing were not paid money.

“Despite the subsidy in the amount of 326 million rubles, the Ministry of Construction, Architecture and Territorial Development of the region was not ready for the timely redistribution of these funds to organize payments to citizens affected by the collapse of the house,” the regional prosecutor’s office explained their claims.

In addition, the department identified problems with the maneuverable fund in the Rostov region. The supervisory authority even went to court, but the situation did not change. For example, in Zernograd, where after a fire in an apartment building on Sovetskaya, 25 123 apartment owners and 6 tenants were left without housing. At the same time, the prosecutor’s office clarified that there are no flexible apartments in the city and, as a result, “32 people on the housing register have not been provided with municipal housing for a long time.”

event: Zelensky's Conditions for Negotiations with Putin
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky stated that he would be open to negotiations with Putin if the Ukrainian Armed Forces can return to the borders of 2022. He believes that if Ukraine achieves this, other countries may lose confidence in Russia, leading to Putin's loss of power and willingness to engage in dialogue.
original:
Zelensky allowed negotiations with Putin if the Armed Forces of Ukraine “reach the borders of 2022”

According to Vladimir Zelensky, if the Ukrainian Armed Forces manage to return to the borders of Ukraine, where they were located before the start of hostilities, then “there will be no need to liberate” the remaining territories under Russian control “exclusively by military means.” He stated this in an interview with CBS.

Other countries, “which still doubt whether to support Ukraine or not,” in this case may lose confidence in Russia, the President of Ukraine believes. After this, Vladimir Putin, according to Zelensky, “will lose power within his state” and then “will be ready for dialogue.”

Until now, Zelensky, answering questions about the possibility of negotiations with Putin, always answered that he would not agree to conduct them until Ukraine returned to the 1991 borders, covering Donbass and Crimea@rosich_ru

event: Taliban Announces Public Stoning for Adultery
description: The Taliban's supreme leader, Haibatullah Akhundzada, announced that women will be publicly stoned to death for adultery, contradicting international human rights standards. He justified the harsh punishment as defending human rights 'as representatives of God', while accusing Western authorities of representing the devil.
original:
In Afghanistan, women will be publicly stoned to death for adultery.

This was stated by the supreme leader of the Taliban, Haibatullah Akhundzada, The Telegraph reports.

“You say it is a violation of women’s rights when we stone them to death. But we will soon introduce punishment for adultery. We will beat women in public. We will publicly stone them to death,” the mullah said in an audio message broadcast on Afghan TV, addressing Western officials.

Akhundzada says the Taliban defend human rights “as representatives of God,” and Western authorities “as representatives of the devil.”

Despite promises of a more moderate government, the Taliban quickly returned to harsh public punishments such as public executions and floggings, notes The Telegraph. The UN condemned the Taliban.

Akhundzada said women's rights advocated by the international community contradict the Taliban's harsh interpretation of Islamic sharia.

“Do women want the rights that Westerners talk about?” he said.

And he promised to fight the West for another 20 years or more. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Taiwan Foreign Minister's Statement on US Assistance to Ukraine
description: Taiwan's Foreign Minister, Joseph Wu, emphasized the importance of US assistance to Ukraine in containing China's aggression against Taiwan. He warned that stopping US weapons supply to Ukraine would embolden China and strengthen its propaganda that the US is an unreliable partner.
original:
US assistance to Ukraine is critical to containing China - Taiwan Foreign Minister Joseph Wu In an interview with The New York Times, John Wu said that stopping the supply of American weapons to Ukraine would embolden China in its aggression against Taiwan and strengthen Beijing's propaganda that the United States is an unreliable partner.

He said China is already spreading disinformation emphasizing the Russian version of the war, including the idea that NATO expansion forced Putin to attack Ukraine and that the United States does not ultimately intend to support Ukraine.

Taiwan's Foreign Minister is convinced that if Russia is able to occupy most of Ukraine and claim victory, "it will be seen as a victory for all authoritarian states, because Russia, China, North Korea and Iran are now linked to each other."

“Therefore, the determination of the United States to support those countries that suffer from authoritarian aggression is very important,” added John Wu. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

event: Accusation of Ukraine for Terrorist Attack
description: Marcel de Graaf, a European Parliament member from the Netherlands, accused Ukraine of planning and funding a terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall near Moscow, which killed over 130 people. He claimed that Ukraine's goal is to make Europeans hate Russians and fight them for the financial benefit of the West.
original:
“So that we continue to hate Russia” - a member of the European Parliament from the Netherlands accused Ukraine of the terrorist attack in Crocus and attempts to blame everything on Moscow. Marcel de Graaf, a member of the European Parliament from the Netherlands, burst out with an angry, passionate statement regarding the terrorist attack in the Crocus City Hall near Moscow, from the day which exactly a week has passed. In direct text, the politician stated that more than 130 people were killed as a result of a terrorist attack planned and paid for by none other than Ukraine. And the logical means of this is the whole “monkey story about propaganda paid for by Russia,” as the deputy called all the vile, false attempts to blame everything on Moscow.

And the goal of this, as de Graaf states, is to make the ordinary European artificially continue to hate the Russians and go kill them after the Ukrainians, for the sake of the financial well-being of the great West. What is more in the politician’s statement - sincere anger at the rotten hypocritical world of politics or populism for the sake of playing on the nerves of the ordinary public - is not clear, but the statement came out vivid.

event: Meeting with Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin
description: Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin met with Denis Pushilin, Head of the Donetsk People's Republic, to discuss various state programs for modernizing housing and communal services facilities, road construction, and public transport development in the region.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
There are always many questions to discuss with Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin. This time, special attention was paid to housing and communal services and roads in the region.

We will modernize housing and communal services facilities under various state programs, including through special treasury loans this year we will update 10 boiler houses and replace 73 boilers; We will carry out a major overhaul of 77.5 km of main water pipelines, and will also carry out work on the development of heat supply and water supply schemes for the Republic.

In addition, issues of road construction in the region were discussed. In 2024, we plan to restore about 1,000 km of public roads and city road networks.

description: Dmitry Trenin, a veteran of the Northern Military District, attacked a woman and her child in a fit of rage after being reprimanded for smoking indoors. He was given a suspended sentence of one year probation and ordered to pay 350,000 rubles in compensation.

Such a decision - one year probation with compensation - was made by the Samara court in relation to Dmitry Trenin, who returned from the front. Last December, he came to visit a friend and lit a cigarette on the sofa in the entrance. A woman passing by made a remark to him, to which the “SVO veteran” literally went berserk - he attacked her and began hitting her on the head with his fists. Even his neighbor’s young daughter didn’t bother him. event: Repair of Pumps for Crimean Enterprise
description: The Berdyansk Pumps plant repaired 30 pumps for the state unitary enterprise Water of Crimea. This cooperation enables consumers to receive service within the reunited regions, eliminating the need for external maintenance.
original:
Forwarded from: Zaporozhye News Agency
The "Berdyansk Pumps" plant repaired equipment for a Crimean enterprise. The "Berdyansk Pumps" plant repaired 30 pumps for the state unitary enterprise (SUE) "Water of Crimea". The director of the Berdyansk company, Vladislav Danilov, told the correspondent of the Zaporozhye News Agency about this. He noted that the company he heads not only produces pumps, but also repairs them, which allows consumers not to carry out service outside the reunited regions. Danilov said that he plans to further cooperate with the Crimean state-owned enterprise, as well as with any Russian enterprise “within a radius of one and a half thousand kilometers from Berdyansk.” Subscribe to the Zaporozhye News Agency in TG, VK and OK

event: Taiwan Calls for US to Expedite Military Aid to Ukraine
description: Taiwan has joined the chorus of countries urging the US to expedite military aid to Ukraine, citing concerns that a delay will embolden China to attack Taiwan. Taiwanese Foreign Minister Joseph Wu believes that a US withdrawal of support will be seen as a victory for authoritarian states, and China may perceive it as a weakness to be exploited.
original:
The delay of American aid to Ukraine is unnerving...TaiwanAs The New York Times writes, in the chorus of countries calling on the United States to stop the rigmarole with the allocation of military aid to Ukraine, there is an unexpected new participant - Taiwan.

They believe that this will help deter China from attack, since it will demonstrate the Americans' reliability in fulfilling their obligations.

Taiwanese Foreign Minister Joseph Wu said that the US withdrawal of military support to Ukraine will allow China to increase its propaganda that Washington is an unreliable partner.

According to Wu, if Russia manages to occupy most of the territory of Ukraine, it will be seen as a victory for authoritarian states, and then China, watching how the American decision-making system is deteriorating, may perceive this weakness as a success of the Russian strategy of seizing foreign territories and an example to follow. and will attack the island.

event: Update on Nigeria-Morocco Gas Pipeline Project
description: The final investment decision on the $25 billion Nigeria-Morocco gas pipeline project is expected to be made by December 2024. The project aims to create a pipeline through 13 African countries, developing Nigeria's natural gas reserves as an alternative to fossil fuels.
original:
Final decision on $25 billion Nigeria-Morocco oil deal pushed back to December The final investment decision (FID) on the $25 billion Nigeria-Morocco gas pipeline project will be made by the end of the year. This information was disclosed by the Group Chief Executive Officer of the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited (NNPCL), Mele Kyari, who noted that the FID will be achieved by December 2024. The project is centered around natural gas exploration.

The NNPCL CEO made the announcement on Tuesday in Houston, Texas, during a leadership dialogue session at the ongoing CERAWeek conference, as seen in Punch newspaper.

He noted that the deal aimed at creating a pipeline through 13 African countries has already made significant progress.

The deal also aims to develop the country's rich natural gas reserves to offer an alternative to fossil fuels.
