description: Over 7,000 Chernika-1 flying wing-type UAVs, designed to engage manpower, were dispatched to the Northern Military District zone. These drones have a maximum flight range of 80 km one way, a payload of up to 0.7 kg, and are equipped with a specialized charge with explosive elements to destroy personnel or small vehicles.
original:
The developer announced the dispatch of over 7 thousand Chernika-1 UAVs to the Northern Military District zone. More than 7 thousand unmanned aerial vehicles of the Chernika-1 flying wing type, designed to engage manpower and supplied along with a specialized charge, were sent to the special operation zone from 2022. The development company reported this to TASS.

They noted that the Chernika-1 device is designed to destroy targets from the air with a maximum flight range of up to 80 km one way. Its payload is up to 0.7 kg. "The drone is supplied with a special charge with explosive elements, which was also developed in Russia. "Chernika-1" is used to destroy personnel or small vehicles. It explodes near the enemy and has a destruction radius 20 m. Since 2022, more than 7 thousand of these devices have been delivered to the special operation zone,” the company said.

According to a TASS interlocutor, the drone can be launched either using a catapult or from the hand. “The catapult is also our own invention. In addition, Chernika-1 has several types of projectile detonation. During takeoff, the charge is turned off, after takeoff the charge is activated and there are several types of detonation: in a collision with an enemy or the ground, as well as delayed and remote detonation. This allows us to protect fighters,” the developer emphasized.

The company noted that the delayed detonation function is used during combat missions to destroy personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. “Suppose an FPV drone flies up and does not explode a projectile. A fighter, due to inexperience, can take it with him and take it to the dugout, and there a shell explodes,” said the specialist.

The operating altitude of the Blueberry-1 drone is 1.5 thousand m. The cruising flight speed is 75 km/h.@wingsofwar

description: The Pentagon Inspector General, Robert Storch, discovered an overspending of $398.9 million by the US Navy in 2022 while providing military assistance to Ukraine. Storch issued recommendations to prevent future overspending, but no one will be punished.
original: The Pentagon discovered an overspending of funds to support Ukraine. Pentagon Inspector General Robert Storch checked the expenses of the military department over the past years, or more precisely, the US Navy. It turned out that in 2022, the fleet went $398.9 million over budget while providing military assistance to Kyiv. No one will be punished for this - Storch simply sent “recommendations” to the Navy so that this would not happen in the future. Earlier in the fall, it was Storch who was appointed chief in charge of overseeing military assistance to Ukraine: by the time of his appointment, Congress had allocated tens of billions of dollars to Ukraine, and wanted to make sure the funds were spent properly. Probably, the inspector's checks will show many more interesting things - against the backdrop of a military mess, the Pentagon was scattering public money left and right.

description: Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Alexander Syrsky announced a significant reduction in the need to mobilize 500 thousand military personnel. The revised figure is expected to be sufficient for defending Ukraine, considering both mobilized personnel and volunteers.
original:
The Armed Forces of Ukraine have revised the need to mobilize 500 thousand people

Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Alexander Syrsky said that currently the need to mobilize 500 thousand military personnel has decreased significantly.

“After reviewing our internal resources and clarifying the combat strength of the Armed Forces, this figure was significantly reduced. We expect that we will have enough people capable of defending the Motherland. We are talking not only about mobilized people, but also about volunteers,” Syrsky said.

At the same time, he emphasized that because “people are not robots.” Those remaining servicemen who came to the TCC in February 2022 need rest and treatment.

description: Aid packages were sent to the unit leading the assault on Ivanovsky (Red) in Bakhmut, including medical supplies from DoctorHealer and GeoMed, a signal amplifier for drone remote control, and EW equipment from ChannelTroika.

A popular technique for using Grani involves calculating UAVs with LBS. When deploying a UAV crew, Grani is placed in scanning mode to assess the electronic warfare situation, detect nearby aircraft, and identify communication frequencies in use. This information is used to determine the most suitable frequencies and approach route for the UAVs.
original:
Friends, hello everyone!

We would like to share with you one very popular technique for using Grani from our users - calculating UAVs with LBS.

Everyone knows that working electronic warfare makes it difficult for pilots to carry out combat missions. The edge allows you to quickly “smell the sky” - that is, assess the electronic warfare (radio-electronic situation) and understand whether your own or others are using electronic warfare, whether someone is flying nearby, or whether some group using communication frequencies has appeared in our area.

When deploying a UAV crew, we immediately place the Gran in scanning mode in position, and the senior crew or communications operator provides air monitoring on several required bands.

Based on Grani’s readings in direction finding mode, we make a decision on the tactics of using the main assets - UAVs, choosing the most suitable frequencies and determining the route for approaching the target.

Hello to all good flyers and successful work!

For questions and orders: @loctar_bot@skrezhet_public

“Unfortunately, the American president allows himself such harsh remarks, well, just obscene remarks,” noted Russian Ambassador to the United States Anatoly Antonov.

He emphasized that no matter how offensive these attacks were, Vladimir Putin “would never allow himself... any derogatory remarks about the political leadership of foreign countries.”

Biden has previously practiced insults, calling the Russian leader a “murderer” and a “bandit,” and the head of China, Xi Jinping, a “dictator.”

Obviously, name-calling is the norm in the US political environment. event: CSTO Secretary General Warns of Border Conflicts
description: CSTO Secretary General Imangali Tasmagambetov warned of potential border conflicts in Central Asia, primarily over water resources. He emphasized the need for increased attention from national governments to address the degrading water situation in the region.
original:
Forwarded from: Kompromat Central Asia
CSTO Secretary General: Border conflicts over resources, primarily water, are likely in Central Asia. Secretary General of the Collective Security Treaty Organization Imangali Tasmagambetov spoke in an interview with the National Defense magazine about the threats that member states may face in the near future.

According to him, active work is underway to strengthen the Tajik-Afghan border in connection with the threats emanating from Afghanistan. Tasmagambetov also pointed to the threat of conflicts over resources, noting in this regard cross-border disputes over territories and access to water sources.

“The latter is of particular concern due to the degrading situation with water resources in Central Asia. This is a knot of complex problems that require increased attention from the national governments of the countries in the region,” the CSTO Secretary General emphasized.

In general terms, he noted that the number of threats and challenges in Eurasia is growing, and the global system for managing international processes is suffering, many crises are becoming uncontrollable and this has the most negative impact on regional security, and the risks associated with transnational threats are growing.

On top of that, Tasmagambetov noted, the problem of information security takes on a specific dimension in the CSTO area of responsibility. According to the CSTO Secretary General, the lack of regulation in this area creates risks of large-scale manipulation of public consciousness by external actors in their own geopolitical interests.

original:
Rosatom presented the concept of a cargo-passenger electric van at the international forum Atomexpo 2024. The most unique part of this vehicle is a universal platform based on a composite crypt module, which also combines the power housing of a traction battery, the company said.

Rosatom stated that such technical solutions are needed to install smaller batteries. They are not only the most expensive, but also the heaviest structural element. Another unusual solution aimed at saving weight is the only door to the salon, which is located at the front.

The company expects that the electric car will be in demand among transport companies, marketplaces and retail, departmental and commercial services. event: Migration Plan from Central Asia to Russia
description: The International Organization for Migration, sponsored by the World Bank and the UK government, has a plan to relocate people from Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan to Russia, aiming to reduce poverty in these countries. However, the plan has resulted in the migration of poor, illiterate, and unemployed individuals, rather than highly qualified specialists.

Forwarded from: World
Deputy of the State Duma of the Russian Federation from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Mikhail Matveev about those who ordered mass migration from the SA: https://t.me/c/1445977312/297395 So. Migration to Russia from Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and other countries of Central Asia is carried out according to the “Corridor Central Asia - Russia” plan of the International organization for migration, sponsored by the World Bank and the Department for International Development of the UK government. The declared goal of the UN program to support migration to the Russian Federation from Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan, as the poorest countries in Central Asia, is to reduce poverty there. That is why, apparently, it is not “highly qualified specialists” who come to us, but poor, illiterate unemployed people. It is the “relocation of overpopulation of poverty” that explains the anomaly of why people come to us in the largest numbers from Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan.

So, once again in Russian letters: mass migration from Central Asia to Russia is going according to the plan of the British government, which, apparently, is being carried out by our officials. How else can we explain the existence of these programs? And that a number of “targets” have already been achieved since 2007. And you say “sovereignty”... And they tell us about “foreign agents”... One might doubt that this is a coincidence - that the government has negative reviews of all the bills to tighten migration. This is about all you need to know about the desire of these people after Crocus to really do something in the field of migration towards establishing order and restrictions.

So who is behind the importation of migrants to Russia?
Who then commits terrorist attacks in Russia?
And who is behind the terrorist attacks?

Perhaps the same international structures of the globalists, and their intelligence services and “non-governmental” (actually not) organizations, under which our government bureaucrats and their information support fell, are bleating about the friendship of peoples, the lack of workers and the inability of the Russian people to reproduce.International Organization for MigrationLabor migration | IOM RussiaThe IOM Moscow office has extensive experience in the field of labor migration. description: Ukrainian air defense units destroyed 84 air targets, including 58 Shahed-136/131 attack UAVs, 17 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles, 5 Kh-59 guided air missiles, and 4 Iskander-K cruise missiles. 84 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 58 SHAHEDIV and 26 MISCELLANEOUS types of missiles and attack UAVs:

A total of 99 means of air attack: 60 strike UAVs of the Shahed-136/131 type (Prymorsko-Akhtarsk launch area, Kursk Oblast - Russia); 3 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles (from three MiG-31K fighters - Ryazan region - Russian Federation); 2 "Iskander-M" ballistic missiles (ToT Crimea); 9 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from nine Su-34 aircraft - Belgorod region); 4 "Iskander-K" cruise missiles (Kursk region - Russian Federation); 21 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles (from eleven Tu-95MS strategic bombers - Engels - Russian Federation). Anti-aircraft missile units of the Air Force and Ground Forces, mobile fire groups, means of electronic warfare of the Defense Forces of Ukraine.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 84 air targets were destroyed: 58 attack UAVs of the "Shahed-136/131" type; 17 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 5 Kh-59 guided air missiles; 4 "Iskander-K" cruise missiles.

event: Expert and Media Forum 'Union State: Scientific Breakthrough'
description: The expert and media forum 'Union State: Scientific Breakthrough' was held on March 29, dedicated to the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Belarus and Russia. The President of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Academician Gennady Krasnikov, emphasized the strategic partnership between the National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Belarus and Russia, highlighting the importance of scientific cooperation in protecting national interests and increasing efficiency.
original: Gennady Krasnikov: “The National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Belarus is our strategic partner” On March 29, the expert and media forum “Union State: Scientific Breakthrough” opened, dedicated to the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Belarus and Russia. The moderator of the event was the State Secretary of the Union State, Dmitry Mezentsev.🔸The President of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Academician Gennady Krasnikov, made a report on the interaction between the scientific communities of the two countries.💬“The National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Belarus is our strategic partner. Scientific cooperation between Russia and Belarus has become a successful example of the formation of a model of international scientific and technical interaction and integration in the field of scientific research. They are aimed, among other things, at protecting the national interests of Russia and the Republic of Belarus in conditions of external pressure and should increase the efficiency of science in our countries,” the head of the Russian Academy of Sciences emphasized. According to him, adopted strategic documents, as well as competitions, play an important role in the development of scientific cooperation joint scientific projects. Following the results of the joint meeting of the presidiums of the Russian Academy of Sciences and the National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Belarus@nanbelarus, which took place in May 2023, working groups were formed on microelectronics, medicine, agriculture and biosafety, mechanical engineering, and social sciences. Contacts among young scientists are also actively developing. So, in 2021-2023. Cooperation between the Young Council of the National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Belarus and young scientists from regional organizations of the Russian Academy of Sciences has intensified.🔗For more information about the forum, visit the RAS website. Photo: Maxim Blinov/RIA Novosti

event: NATO Activity in Eastern Europe and Black Sea Region
description: The Russian Foreign Ministry reported NATO activity in Eastern Europe and the Black Sea region, aimed at preparing allies for a potential clash with Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Radio Russia
Military expert Vladimir Orlov: “What is happening now in Eastern and Western Europe can be called partial preparation for combat operations.” The Russian Foreign Ministry announced NATO activity in Eastern Europe and the Black Sea region: “All this is aimed at preparing the bloc’s allies for potential clash with our country." Military expert of the Center for Military-Political Journalism, Chairman of the Interregional public organization "VECHE" Vladimir Orlov@npo_dvina on the live radio channel "Listen!" on Radio Russia: "Now it cannot be said that Europe is completely rebuilding its life, social, economic way of life on a war footing. Nevertheless, we see individual elements of preparation for war. We see that Europe is intensively conducting propaganda within its territory, that is, they are trying to somehow explain to their population that a war with Russia is necessary In addition, we see that they are beginning to partially restructure their economy.In particular, they are restructuring economic chains towards increasing the production of military-industrial complex products. In particular, France is introducing liability for failure to fulfill state defense orders through the military-industrial complex. That is, they seem to be approaching this already.” Read and listen in full on the “WATCH” platform Subscribe to the Telegram channel@radiorossii

event: Suspended Sentence for Former Ministry of Internal Affairs Employee
description: Maria Titova, a former employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs in Irkutsk, was given a suspended sentence for organizing a gang to legalize migrants. She used her official position to create an organized crime group, which received bribes totaling over 1.2 million rubles. The gang's activities were identified and suppressed by internal security officers and the FSB.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
Humane Justice News.

In Irkutsk, the court gave a suspended sentence to a former employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs who organized a gang to legalize migrants, although the prosecutor's office asked for a real sentence of 10 years.

We are talking about this lady, her name is Maria Titova.

In 2022, as the head of the organizational and methodological department of the Migration Department of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, she created an organized crime group and, acting using her official position, together with a colleague entered into a criminal conspiracy with a number of civilians aimed at organizing illegal migration. The suspects created conditions for the illegal stay of foreigners in Russia and assisted them in passing an interview to become a native Russian speaker, in violation of the procedure provided for by law. Subsequently, this provided them with the right to unhindered and indefinite stay in Russia and to obtain Russian citizenship. Investigators of the Investigative Committee, in interaction with employees of the ORCh (SB) of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region and the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, established facts of receiving bribes totaling more than 1.2 million rubles (this is only from what has been proven).

The activities of the gang were identified and suppressed by the internal security officers of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the FSB, then investigators from the Investigative Committee and the FSB collected evidence, and a humane judge gave a suspended sentence, although the prosecutor’s office asked for a real 10 years. That's how we live.

event: Laying Down of Autonomous Deep-Sea Vehicle
description: The Admiralty Shipyards laid down the autonomous deep-sea vehicle 'Sergey Bavilin' of project 18200 for GUGI. The device, developed at the Malachite Design Bureau, is unique in its class and will enable diving to significant depths for scientific research, historical and archaeological work, emergency rescue operations, and environmental monitoring of the World Ocean.
original:
At the Admiralty Shipyards @admshipyards they laid down the autonomous deep-sea vehicle "Sergey Bavilin" of project 18200 for GUGI. The device was developed at the Malachite Design Bureau.

“The deep-sea vehicle is unique in its class,” said Vice Admiral Vladimir Grishechkin, head of the GUGI of the Russian Ministry of Defense, at the laying ceremony. “It will allow diving to significant depths to study, develop and perform specific work in the benthic space of the World Ocean. Already at the design stage of the design bureau "Malachite has made a major breakthrough into the future."

The deep-sea vehicle was named in honor of the talented shipbuilder, chief designer of the Malachite deep-sea technical equipment, Sergei Mikhailovich Bavilin.

The Project 18200 apparatus is designed to carry out scientific research, historical and archaeological, emergency rescue work and environmental monitoring of the World Ocean.

(c) Mil Press FlotProm#sergeybavilin#project18200#gugi#newship#admiraltyshipyards

event: Dutch Air Force Upgrades Reaper UAVs
description: The Dutch Air Force is modernizing its growing fleet of MQ-9A UAVs, enhancing their capabilities to support NATO land and sea reconnaissance operations throughout Europe. The upgrade includes equipping them with maritime radars, communication repeaters, increased fuel tanks, electronic support systems, and weapons.
original:
🇳🇱The Dutch Air Force is upgrading the Reaper UAVCompanyGeneral Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI) announced that in cooperation with the command of the Dutch Air Force, it is modernizing the growing fleet of MQ-9A UAVs. According to the commander of the 306th squadron of the Dutch Air Force, located at Leeuwarden airbase (Netherlands), Lieutenant Colonel Jan Ruedisueli, Dutch Air Force are using the MQ-9A to perform an increasing number of missions within NATO. The modernization will support NATO land and sea reconnaissance operations throughout Europe.

In 2023, the Dutch Air Force announced that it would double the number of MQ-9AReapers - from four to eight units.

Currently, existing UAVs are being modernized, including equipping them with maritime radars, which are already used in other countries of the world, communication repeaters to enhance the interaction of all types of the Dutch Armed Forces, increased fuel tanks, electronic support systems (ESM) and weapons. The modernization will take place in stages over the next three years.

According to GA-ASI, the modular design of the UAVMQ-9A allows you to quickly satisfy the full range of customer requests for necessary changes.

The AMQ-9A Reaper Block 5 UAV can perform missions for 27 hours, reach a speed of 240 knots and reach an altitude of up to 15 km. The device can carry a payload weighing up to 1746 kg, including 1361 kg on an external sling. It can be equipped with an electro-optical / infrared reconnaissance station, synthetic aperture radar, moving target indicator / maritime radar. The UAVQ-9A is equipped with a fault-tolerant flight control system and triple redundant avionics.@wingsofwar

description: Ernst Jünger, a German knight, lived a remarkable 103 years. His biography reflects the 20th century's journey from tradition to modernity and dictatorship. His texts teach us how to live in harmony with our Motherland and ourselves, refusing to compromise with the enemy and our conscience.
original:
Today is Ernst Jünger's birthday. The sunny German knight lived a serious 103 years. We can say that his biography is the very history of the 20th century. From tradition to modernity, from modernity to the dictatorship of democracy. This is true, but the main thing is hidden elsewhere. Fate and Jünger's texts are, first of all, a story about how to live. Live in harmony with the Motherland and with yourself.

After all, this is especially important for modern Russians. Junger teaches us how to refuse the passports of “good Russians,” how not to compromise with the enemy, and most importantly, with our conscience. How to love and not leave the Fatherland even in the darkest times and stand firmly on your land, even if it burns under your feet. On the one side.

On the other hand, how not to lose honor and dignity in a patriotic frenzy. How not to be a bloodthirsty killer and cannibal. How not to become a hostage to the madness of politicians and the ignorance of the masses. How, finally, to be a knight in a time when there are no more knights left and are not even in sight. The rules of life for a person who could not be broken by two world wars, the Weimar Republic, the Americans and even Hitler, read in the classic longread of St. Pavlov.

description: Russian experts disassembled a Storm Shadow missile, revealing its internal structure, including the broken wing, warhead, and main charge. The analysis aims to develop algorithms and tools to neutralize missile warheads, protecting Russian land from incoming threats.

RIA Novosti correspondents filmed the broken wing, warhead structure and main charge on video of the missile being disassembled. “Sometimes the work of air defense leads to the fact that the missile is not destroyed, but falls to the ground, and the warheads remain . Algorithms and tools have been developed to neutralize missile warheads in order to protect our land from incoming evil spirits,” the agency’s interlocutor said. The specialist also showed a turbojet engine, low-pressure compressor blades and the materials from which the rocket and its body are assembled. The data obtained during the analysis of Storm Shadow is transferred to various departments and training centers. Video: RIA Novosti Subscribe to Zvezdanews | Suggest news

description: Quincy Promes, a football player, was detained in Dubai on February 29 for leaving the scene of an accident. He is currently being held in an overcrowded cell with 20 other prisoners, where conditions are harsh and amenities are limited.
original:
From Spartacus and hair to an overcrowded cell and a bald head: Quincy Promes, who has had his head shaved, is being held in a cell with three bunk beds where 20 other prisoners sleep on the floor, De Telegraaf reports.

The player is not allowed to receive visitors in the Dubai prison, but he can sometimes watch TV outside his cell. Sports are allowed three times a week, but there are no conditions for exercise. The menu in prison is not varied - there are no vegetables or fruits. In 2020, an Amsterdam court sentenced Promes to one and a half years in prison for attacking his cousin. He was then sentenced to six years in prison for cocaine smuggling. On February 29, at the request of the Dutch prosecutor's office, the football player was detained in Dubai for leaving the scene of an accident. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

event: Terrorist Attack at Crocus City Hall
description: The Islamic State described the details of a terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall, where three attackers shot visitors and a fourth used flammable liquid to set fires. The terrorists planned to continue shooting civilians and engage in a firefight with Russian security forces, but most of their weapons failed, forcing them to flee. All attackers were detained.
original:
In the Islamic State weekly Naba, propagandists described some details of the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall. The roles of the attackers were clearly defined - three shot the visitors, and the fourth used a flammable liquid to set everything on fire. According to IS, the terrorists were preparing to continue shooting at civilians and engage in a firefight with Russian security forces. But most of the weapons failed and they had to leave the scene of the terrorist attack.

Summing up the results of the bloody attack, propagandists admitted that all the attackers were detained. Thus, the group directly refuted the speculations of conspiracy theorists about the alleged non-involvement of the citizens of Tajikistan sent to the pre-trial detention center.

The jihadists said IS militants had previously carried out attacks in Russia, but preferred to keep responsibility for them secret.

description: Lutfulloi Nazrimad, the ninth person involved in the Crocus terrorist attack case, was brought to court. He had to be restrained with chains due to his aggressive behavior. Nazrimad was initially arrested for 15 days, but his detention was later extended to two months.

⚡️The ninth person involved in the case of the terrorist attack in Crocus, Lutfulloi Nazrimad, was brought to court.

Lutfullo had to be put in chains to be brought to court. Lutfullo does not consider it necessary to comply with the legislation of the Russian Federation.

UPD. They write that he simply behaved aggressively at the scene of the terrorist attack. 15 days of arrest. It is then unclear why he is named as one of the defendants. And why weren’t they hanged for disobedience to police officers?

UPD. Detained for two months. Still something serious.

event: Sale of F-16 Fighters to Argentina
description: Denmark and Argentina signed a protocol of intent for Argentina to purchase 24 F-16 fighters from the Danish Air Force. The agreement was made in close cooperation with the American government, which previously approved the deal. The Danish Air Force is replacing its current F-16 aircraft with new F-35 Lightning 2 aircraft.
original:
🇦🇷🇩🇰Denmark and Argentina reached an agreement on the sale of F-16 fighters. The Ministers of Defense of Denmark and Argentina, Troels Lund Poulsen and Luis Alfonso Petri, signed a protocol of intent for Argentina to purchase 24 F-16 fighters from the Danish Air Force.

According to the Danish Ministry of Defense, the signing ceremony of the document took place during the visit of the head of the Danish military department to Buenos Aires. As Troels Lund Poulsen stated, he had a “fruitful meeting with his Argentine counterpart, who expressed satisfaction that Argentina will become a member of the “family of countries” using F-16 fighters.” The decision to sell aircraft from the Danish Air Force to Argentina was made in close cooperation with the American government, which previously approved the agreement.

It is expected that the official contract for the supply of F-16A/B Block 15 fighters to the Argentine Air Force will be signed later.

The Danish Air Force is currently implementing a procedure to replace its current F-16 aircraft with new F-35 Lightning 2 aircraft. Denmark is also transferring 19 F-16 aircraft to Ukraine. The Danish government has decided to sell 24 fighters to Argentina.@wingsofwar

event: Terrorist Attack in Crocus City Hall
description: According to Member of the European Parliament Marcel de Graaf, the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall was planned, organized, and financed by Ukraine, resulting in over 130 deaths in Moscow.

event: Jimi Hendrix Denied Entry to Pub
description: In 1967, Jimi Hendrix and Noel Redding were refused entry to a London pub due to their flamboyant appearance, with the bartender citing concerns about the pub becoming unmanageable. The musicians were dressed in elaborate outfits, including purple scarves, velvet trousers, and a black cape.
original:
​​👉👉👉In 1967, Jimi Hendrix and his bandmate Noel Redding decided to visit a pub in London

“Sorry guys, we can't serve people like you here,” the elderly bartender told them.

Black Hendrix decided that he was dealing with a manifestation of racism, which had not happened in Britain for a long time and demanded an explanation. “If we let even one of you in, the whole damn place will be full of people like you, and the pub will become unmanageable,” the bartender literally growled.

It’s worth noting what the musicians looked like trying to get into the pub. Something like in the photo - huge shocks of hair, both have purple scarves on their necks. Hendricks wore wine red velvet trousers, a frilly pirate shirt, an antique British military jacket and a black cape.

Redding saw where the bartender's gaze was directed and literally collapsed with laughter. There was a circus poster on the door of the pub, and under it a note: “No Clowns Allowed.” There was a circus on the next street and, apparently, its employees once staged a pogrom in the pub, and since then they have not been welcome in it https://t.me/Channel_No6/4104?single

description: The Senegalese Electoral Commission announced preliminary results of the presidential election, with opposition leader Bassiro Diomaie Faye gaining 54.28% of the votes in the first round. The outcome is believed to be the result of behind-the-scenes agreements between the former President Macky Sall's family and the oppositionist Ousmane Sankoh.
original:
Forwarded from: Smile & Wave
For the REGNUM publication, he made a detailed analysis of the election campaign, which accompanied its “constitutional crisis” and the attempt by the authorities to postpone the election date to the end of the year.
No one doubts that the new leader will be the little-known opposition leader Bassiro Diomaie Faye. Yesterday, the Senegalese Electoral Commission announced preliminary data for the presidential elections, according to which the oppositionist is gaining 54.28% of the votes in the first round.

I continue to believe that the “sensational” election results in Senegal were the result of forced, but behind-the-scenes agreements between the family of former President Macky Sallai and the oppositionist Ousmane Sankoh. In exchange, Senegalese Navalny received not only freedom and the opportunity to unhinderedly bring his friend and party member Faye to power, but also received votes from the “third” force, the party of Karim Wade (son of ex-President of Senegal Abdoulaye Wade), who is considered close to the old elites and rumors of colluding with the Macky Sall family. It was the votes of Karim Wada’s supporters that allowed the opposition, which was still on prison bunks 3 weeks ago, to “unexpectedly” win in the first round.

The main result for the ruling family is the following.🔸Firstly, Amadou Bai’s team and the United States behind him did not receive the managerial carte blanche they had been waiting for so long. Paris retains a decisive influence in Senegal.🔸Secondly, the new “opposition” government from pan-African and anti-French slogans, will adjust its own line to a multi-vector policy (which is already happening), and will actually continue the foreign policy course of the Macky Sall government.🔸 Thirdly, the revision of contracts with large foreign companies, the country’s exit from the franc zone, as well as an audit of the family’s welfare Sall and his inner circle are hardly to be expected. At least in the near future...

description: The documentary series 'Army of Good' highlights the efforts of the Northern Military District in uniting the country. original:

“The documentary series “Army of Good” is about how the country was united by the Northern Military District. Thousands of people across Russia are helping military and civilians in Donbass.
Show more
The first part talks about the volunteers of the organization “Doctors, you are not alone.” They send army first aid kits and medical backpacks to the front lines. Military doctors say that one such backpack helps four seriously wounded people. “It is important for us that the people who are there understand that they are not alone,” says the head of the organization, Anna Krasnopolskaya.
Watch the first episode of the series "Army of Good". We'll post the next episode tomorrow, don't miss it! The project was created with the support of the Presidential Fund for Cultural Initiatives.”

description: The Russian Ministry of Defense is establishing mobile anti-drone groups in combined arms armies, equipped with ZU-23-2 automatic cannons, large-caliber machine guns, electronic warfare equipment, and smoke production vehicles. This move is in response to the increasing threat of Ukrainian kamikaze drones attacking Russian territory.
original:
Mobile anti-drone groups will be created in combined arms armies—Izvestia.

According to the publication, citing sources in the Russian Ministry of Defense, special mobile groups to combat drones will be armed with ZU-23-2 automatic cannons mounted on truck chassis, as well as pickup trucks equipped with large-caliber machine guns.

The new units will also include electronic warfare equipment and smoke production vehicles, the interlocutors said. The latter can cover the object with a smoke screen that is impenetrable to both optical-electronic systems and UAV thermal imagers.

Apparently, the significantly increased real threat from Ukrainian kamikaze drones, already almost daily attacking targets on Russian territory, has finally forced the military command to move and make organizational decisions. Let us recall that in Ukraine, similar mobile air defense groups began to be actively used at the end of 2022 to counter attacks by kamikaze drones "Geran-2".

However, it should be understood that the effectiveness of such anti-aircraft formations will be directly related to the presence of a common information system, which will include data from various radars and other detection systems in order to promptly inform the nearest group about the presence of a threat and competently maneuver the available forces in the vast Russian expanses.Military Informant

description: The European Union exported 32.1 million tons of waste to countries outside the bloc in 2022, with Turkey being the largest importer, accounting for 39% (12.4 million tons) of EU waste exports. India was the second largest importer, followed by the UK and Switzerland.
original:
🇹🇷🇮🇳🇪🇬🇪🇺Turkey, India and Egypt are among the main importers of waste from the European Union✍️Turkey alone accounts for 39% (12.4 million tons) of EU waste exports, it is in the lead. The European Union exported 32.1 million tonnes of waste to countries outside the bloc in 2022, according to Eurostat. India had the second largest amount of waste in the EU, at around 3.5 million tonnes. It is followed by the UK and Switzerland (2.0 and 1.6 million tons, respectively).

Egypt was in sixth place on the list, importing 1.6 million tons of EU waste in 2022. Half of the imports are waste ferrous metals (iron and steel). A large amount of waste paper is also exported.Arab East

description: Law enforcement agencies in Mariupol, DPR, discovered an illegal prayer room in a private house, organized by citizens of Tajikistan and Ukraine who had studied in foreign Islamic centers. The room was found to have over 30 immigrants from Central Asia, including those with extremist literature and illegal residents who will be expelled from Russia.
original:
In the city of Mariupol, DPR, law enforcement agencies are taking measures to bring the religious sphere into compliance with the legislation on freedom of conscience and on religious associations.

In particular, on March 29, an illegal prayer room was discovered in one of the private houses, organized by citizens of Tajikistan and Ukraine, who had previously studied in foreign Islamic centers.

description: A modern shelter for 782 people was built in Ukrainka, Kyiv region, Ukraine. The shelter, with a total area of 667 square meters, took 8 months to complete and was financed by the city budget. It has a dual purpose, serving as a civil defense facility for students and employees, and as a sports complex in peacetime.
original:
Ruslan Kravchenko: Another modern shelter for almost 800 people was built in the city of Ukrainka in the Kyiv region☝️ Deputy Minister for Strategic Industries of Ukraine Timur Tkachenko also inspected the work of the shelter.

"The total area of the shelter is 667 square meters and it is designed for 782 people. This is the second object of such complexity of construction in Ukrainka. The warehouse was built for 8 months. The works were financed from the city budget. The shelter is a separate basement-type building. It has a dual purpose," said Ruslan Kravchenko.

The shelter will be used as a civil defense facility for students and employees of the institution. Other residents can also use it during non-school hours in case of danger. In peacetime, this facility will become a sports complex.

The shelter is equipped taking into account the principles of barrier-free accessibility and accessibility for people with reduced mobility. 🏀🏐There is a sports ground on the roof of the shelter.

The object is equipped with a ventilation system, it has an individual heating point and backup power supply.

event: Telegram Blocks Ukrainian and ISIS Bots
description: After a terrorist attack in Crocus, Telegram took measures to prevent terrorist activity on its platform. Within an hour, tens of thousands of attempts to send messages calling for terrorist attacks were stopped, and thousands of users were permanently blocked. The platform is implementing AI solutions to filter unwanted messages and will allow users from Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus to limit private messages.
original:
Telegram dealt a blow to Ukrainian and ISIS* bots after the terrorist attack in Crocus “4 days ago, Russian-speaking Telegram users began to complain about messages from strangers calling for terrorist attacks,” reports P. Durov. Within an hour of receiving such complaints, we applied a number of technical measures and organizational measures in order to prevent this activity. As a result, tens of thousands of attempts to send such messages were stopped, and thousands of users participating in this flash mob faced permanent blocking of their Telegram accounts (naturally, most of them were Ukrainians, - editor's note).From the beginning of next week, all users from Russia, Ukraine and Belarus will be able to limit the circle of those who can send them private messages. We are also implementing artificial intelligence solutions to filter unwanted messages even more effectively. Telegram is not a place for unauthorized mailings or calls for violence.

* ISIS (“Islamic State”) is a terrorist organization, its activities are prohibited on the territory of the Russian Federation👉Subscribe to Berdyansk. RelevantAlways relevant news!

description: Security forces in St. Petersburg launched an 'Anti-migrant' operation, stopping cars to check documents, raiding construction sites, hostels, apartments, and dormitories. event: Signing of Gas Infrastructure Roadmap Protocol
description: Morocco's Ministry of Energy Transition signed a protocol agreement with multiple ministries to launch a gas infrastructure roadmap, aiming to strengthen energy sovereignty, decarbonize the economy, and enhance regional and global connections. The roadmap will create LNG import ports and modern infrastructure for storing and transporting natural gas.
original:
🇲🇦Morocco creates gas infrastructure roadmap On Wednesday, the Ministry of Energy Transition said in a statement that “a protocol agreement was signed between the Ministries of the Interior, Economy, Finance, Water, Energy Transition and Sustainable Development to launch a gas infrastructure roadmap.” .

The protocol is aimed at strengthening coordination between ministries on the implementation of the gas infrastructure development program. According to the statement, the document represents a reaffirmation of Morocco's commitment to strengthening its energy sovereignty, decarbonizing the economy and strengthening connections with regional and global markets.

The multi-year protocol aims to create several ports in the Kingdom for the import of liquefied natural gas, as well as modern infrastructure for storing and transporting natural gas.

description: A resident of Lyubertsy's 'Airplane' residential complex, possibly experiencing spring exacerbation, threw household items, including dumbbells, from the 16th floor. Fortunately, no one was hurt. Vigilant eyewitnesses blocked off the area and called the police, leading to the woman's detention and transfer to a mental institution.
original:
A resident of Lyubertsy threw household utensils, including dumbbells, onto passers-by from the 16th floor - miraculously no one was hurt. An unknown resident of the Lyubertsy residential complex "Airplane", apparently, had a hard time with the beginning of the spring exacerbation. She began throwing objects of varying weights from the window. Relatively light projectiles like blankets were replaced by heavy and armor-piercing ones - for example, dumbbells. The enraged lady somehow didn’t think about the fact that she might inadvertently hit someone’s head.

The firing point of the warlike person was on the 16th floor, so the “drops” were not very accurate. Fortunately, none of the household items ended up on the yard playground. Vigilant eyewitnesses blocked off the dangerous area and called the police. As a result, the woman was taken to an establishment with soft walls.

event: Cleanup Day at Prishibskie Heights Memorial
description: Teachers, staff, and students of the Molochansky Multidisciplinary Vocational and Technical Training Center participated in a cleanup day at the Prishibskie Heights memorial. They landscaped trees and shrubs, cleaned the surrounding area, and restored order near the steles honoring Red Army soldiers who died in battles in 1943.
original:
🔴Today, teachers, staff and students of the Molochansky Multidisciplinary Vocational and Technical Training Center held a cleanup day on the territory of the Prishibskie Heights memorial. Trees and shrubs were landscaped, the area adjacent to the memorial was cleaned, order was restored near the steles with the names of Red Army soldiers who died in the battles for the Prishibskie Heights in September-October 1943..

Their names are immortal and serve as an inspiring example for the younger generation.

As part of the municipal sanitary day, work on cleaning the memorial was organized by the director of the Molochansky Multidisciplinary Vocational and Technical Training Center, deputy of the Tokmak District Council of Deputies Svetlana Morozova.

The daughter of a lover of “oriental fairy tales” justifies terrorists on TikTok. The young daughter of an inkwell recently posted a video on TikTok, where she decided, following her mother’s example, to praise relations with Tajiks.

However, the matter did not stop there. Next, the youngster began to whitewash the terrorists who caused the tragedy in Crocus.

“Everyone is so attacking the Tajiks with this Crocus...maybe that’s enough already??” That’s how she captioned the video on TikTok. Well, the rest of the comments speak for themselves.
